intro: Odostelma adulterina, commonly known as the false flax or bastard flax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and branching. Odostelma adulterina is known for its ornamental value and has been cultivated for its attractive floral display.
